action.action-desc: Mr. Green of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require covered issuers to carry out a racial equity audit every 2 years, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Securities and Exchange Atonement Act of 2022.

subsection.text: The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78a et seq.) is amended by inserting after section 13A the following:
Not later than the end of the 6-month period beginning on the date of enactment of this section, and every 2 years thereafter, each covered issuer shall—

paragraph.text: conduct an independent audit to assess—

subparagraph.text: the issuer’s policies and practices on civil rights, equity, diversity, and inclusion;
how such policies and practices affect the issuer’s business; and
whether the issuer had direct or indirect ties to or profited from the institution of slavery;

paragraph.text: issue a report to the Commission containing—

subparagraph.text: all findings and determinations made in carrying out the assessments required under paragraph (1); and
to the extent the issuer identifies ties to or profits from the institution of slavery, a disclosure of the steps the issuer has taken to reconcile such ties or profits; and

paragraph.text: make the report described under paragraph (2) available to the public, including on a website of the issuer.

Any covered issuer that fails to issue a report required under subsection (a)(2), or that reports false, misleading, or inaccurate information on such a report, shall be fined by the Commission in an amount of $20,000 per day until the report is issued, or until the report is corrected to not be false, misleading, or inaccurate, as applicable.

The Commission shall transfer all fines collected pursuant to paragraph (1) to the Secretary of the Treasury and the Secretary shall, without further appropriation, use such funds to carry out the duties of the Office of Reparations Programs.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered issuer means an issuer that—

paragraph.text: is required to file an annual report under section 13(a) or 15(d); and

subsection.text: Chapter 3 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subchapter I, by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: There is established, within the Department of the Treasury, an Office of Reparations Programs.

The Office of Reparations Programs shall provide grants for startup capital and funded savings programs for Black communities, as well other programs determined appropriate by the Secretary in furtherance of racial equity.

paragraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary of the Treasury $3,000,000,000 to carry out this section.
The Secretary may use 2 percent of amounts appropriated to carry out this section for administrative expenses related to carrying out the duties of the Office of Reparations Programs.
